ch.epfl.sdp.peakar.database

Interface DatabaseReference

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FirebaseDatabaseReference

    public interface DatabaseReference
    This interface represents a Database Reference, i.e. a reference to a database child.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.google.firebase.database.ChildEventListener addChildEventListener(com.google.firebase.database.ChildEventListener childEventListener)
      Add a listener for child events occurring at this location.
      com.google.firebase.database.ValueEventListener addValueEventListener(com.google.firebase.database.ValueEventListener valueEventListener)
      Add a listener for changes in the data at this location.
      DatabaseReference child(java.lang.String pathString)
      Get the child with the given path from the current reference.
      DatabaseSnapshot get()
      Get the database snapshot of the current reference.
      java.lang.String getKey()
      Get the key of the current child.
      DatabaseQuery orderByChild(java.lang.String path)
      Create a query in which children are ordered by the values of the specified path.
      DatabaseReference push()
      Create a new child in the current path and return its reference.
      void removeEventListener(com.google.firebase.database.ValueEventListener valueEventListener)
      Remove the given listener from the current reference.
      void removeValue()
      Removes the current child from the database.
      com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void> removeValueAsync()
      Removes asynchronously the current child from the database.
      void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
      Set a value to the current reference.
      com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void> setValueAsync(java.lang.Object value)
      Set asynchronously a value to the current reference.

    • Method Detail

      • child

        DatabaseReference child(java.lang.String pathString)
        Get the child with the given path from the current reference.

      • get

        DatabaseSnapshot get()
        Get the database snapshot of the current reference. Note that this method is a blocking method, meaning that it cannot be used on the UI thread. You may want to run this method on a new thread and, after that, do something else on the UI thread.

      • getKey

        java.lang.String getKey()
        Get the key of the current child.

      • setValueAsync

        com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void> setValueAsync(java.lang.Object value)
        Set asynchronously a value to the current reference.

      • setValue

        void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
        Set a value to the current reference. Note that this method is a blocking method, meaning that it cannot be used on the UI thread. You may want to run this method on a new thread and, after that, do something else on the UI thread.

      • push

        DatabaseReference push()
        Create a new child in the current path and return its reference.

      • removeValueAsync

        com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<java.lang.Void> removeValueAsync()
        Removes asynchronously the current child from the database.

      • removeValue

        void removeValue()
        Removes the current child from the database. Note that this method is a blocking method, meaning that it cannot be used on the UI thread. You may want to run this method on a new thread and, after that, do something else on the UI thread.

      • orderByChild

        DatabaseQuery orderByChild(java.lang.String path)
        Create a query in which children are ordered by the values of the specified path.

      • addValueEventListener

        com.google.firebase.database.ValueEventListener addValueEventListener(com.google.firebase.database.ValueEventListener valueEventListener)
        Add a listener for changes in the data at this location. Each time time the data changes, your listener will be called with an immutable snapshot of the data.

      • addChildEventListener

        com.google.firebase.database.ChildEventListener addChildEventListener(com.google.firebase.database.ChildEventListener childEventListener)
        Add a listener for child events occurring at this location. When child locations are added, removed, changed, or moved, the listener will be triggered for the appropriate event.

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(com.google.firebase.database.ValueEventListener valueEventListener)
        Remove the given listener from the current reference.
